info.headline: Blowing Dust Advisory issued March 18 at 7:40PM CDT until March 19 at 3:00AM CDT by NWS Amarillo TX
info.description:
* WHAT...For the Blowing Dust Advisory, visibility between one-quarter and one mile in blowing dust. For the High Wind Warning, northwest winds 30 to 40 mph with gusts up to 60 mph.
* WHERE...In Oklahoma, Beaver County. In Texas, Hemphill and Lipscomb Counties.
* WHEN...For the Blowing Dust Advisory, until 3 AM CDT Wednesday. For the first High Wind Warning and second High Wind Warning, until 9 AM CDT Wednesday.
* IMPACTS...Hazardous driving conditions due to reduced visibility. Damaging winds will blow down trees and power lines. Travel will be difficult, especially for high profile vehicles.
info.instruction:
Persons with respiratory problems should make preparations to stay indoors until the storm passes. Be ready for a sudden drop in visibility to near zero. If you encounter blowing dust or blowing sand on the roadway or see it approaching, pull off the road as far as possible and put your vehicle in park. Turn the lights all the way off and keep foot off the brake pedal. Remember, 'Pull Aside, Stay Alive'.
Remain in the lower levels of your home during the windstorm, and avoid windows. Watch for falling debris and tree limbs. Use caution if you must drive.

parameter.value: BLOWING DUST ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 AM CDT WEDNESDAY... ...HIGH WIND WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM CDT WEDNESDAY
